name: Cherry Mills Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in room A (fireplace room), very quiet and comfortable, with private bath. Streamside location was perfect for us and our friends to have "happy hour" on the spacious 2nd floor porch. Breakfast was 5* delicious, especially the homemade breads. Dushore is a nice little town which is only a 5 min. drive, great ice cream at Mary Beth's.
reviews.title: would not hesitate to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great bed and breakfast. It does not have all the amentities that you would get at a large hotel, but the hotel is charming, quiet, and comfortable, and the owners are wonderful.
reviews.title: Best hotel breakfast ever -- they should open a restaurant!

reviews.text: We stayed in Guest Room E, which is a three bedroom suite. The rooms were large, clean, and comfortable. The bed was great as well. The bathroom was large and had everything you need: towels, soap, etc.
reviews.title: We believe they do not work for money, they work for personal satisfaction

reviews.text: There are no TVs in the rooms, but there is fast and free wireless internet. The hotel is set off from the main road, so it is very peaceful in the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was fantastic. There is coffee and hot tea available, with a wide selection of teas. When we sat down, we were each given half of a large muffin -- it was magnificent! -- and a dish of applesauce. We were given a choice of several hot breakfasts. I had eggs, sausages, and bread. The eggs were very large, and the bread was a miniature loaf which was delicious. We were given orange juice with the meal, as well as a dish of strawberry jam. The strawberry jam was spectacular: it seemed to be pure strawberries! It was sweet and very tasty. On top of the great food, the service was great: warm, friendly and fast. It really was the best breakfast I've ever had at any establishment.
reviews.title: Very quaint & relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband a few weeks ago for one and we ended up in a suite, with three bedrooms and a bathroom for only $79 for the night. I don't expect much from a B&B for that price, so I was pleasantly surprised by the space, cleanliness and wonderful breakfast. The breakfast was even made to order with a scone and small fruit salad.
reviews.title: Wonderful value for the cost

reviews.text: You probably need to appreciate old building to really enjoy it. The floors are a bit creaky, but the house has some wonderful character and the hosts are very laid back and helpful. The location is a bit out of the way, but that was exactly what I was looking for for my trip.
reviews.title: A Great Home to take your Family and Relax

reviews.text: This is a great place to escape!
reviews.title: Quiet & relaxing, great host family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I planned a short vacation to hike Rickett's Glen in Pennsylvania for my Family. I did an Internet search of the area for a Bed and Breakfast large enough to accommodate my entire family. I found Cherry Mills. After a few emails with the owners I decided to rent the entire Bed and Breakfast. When I arrived my Daughter and her Husband had already claimed the bedroom that they wanted and were sitting on the 2nd floor front porch enjoying the cool breeze and the sound of the nearby Creek. When we arrived we were greeted by the owners, and a very friendly Dog. We were told that we had the entire 2nd floor and the use of the large living room and breakfast area downstairs. My Wife and I stayed in Guest Room A - a very nice room with a view of the creek and a private bathroom. The rest of my family arrived and had to choose what room they wanted. Hard Choice! We hiked during the day and played cards and board games in the Breakfast area at night. Even Breakfast was a hard choice, starting with a plate of fruit, Scones, Juice & Coffee, then having to choose from 7 items on the menu, all cooked to perfection by the owners and served by their wonderful family. Overall this is a great place to take off your shoes, kick back and enjoy the peace and quiet. My Family can't wait to return.
reviews.title: We always look forward to returning to this lovely bed and breakfast!

reviews.text: We had the fireplace room. Great room. Other members of my family filled out the second floor. All were pleased with their rooms....1 room, room C, small for couple though. Had fun visiting with my family members for 4 nights. Great breakfastes. Wonderful host family. Played boards games and relaxed. Front porch steps need work. Be very careful.
reviews.title: Great Bargain

reviews.text: This is one of our favorite places to stay as we have been there 3 times now. We have 3 small boys who love to go as much as we do. It is a breath of fresh air to step away from the busyness of life and relax as a family. It's great to go hiking, sleep in, play cards and games, and just enjoy each other. The town of Dushore is charming and the Kiners are very knowledgeable, kind and helpful. We always have a wonderful stay and we long for the company of the family, the quiet of the surroundings and the beautiful simplicity of the inn after we leave.....not to mention the blueberry pancakes and home roasted coffee!
reviews.title: A Family Favorite

reviews.text: We were there on the last Monday in March 2010. We went for a relaxing time, and that is exactly what we received. It is an old hotel, 1865, so don't expect a 5 star hotel with TV, radio etc. You won't get it. What you will receive is a very old hotel, that is a grand place to relax, read, play cards or just talk. We had a really nice time. It is only 18 miles from the beautiful Ricketts Glen S.P. which is unbelievable wit all of it's gorgeous waterfalls.Cherry Mills was the perfect place to come back to and relax at, after a steep and exhausting hike up the waterfalls trail.The host were quite gracious to us, telling us about Woolrich, Pa and places to dine at. To take the chill out, since our weather wasn't the best, Michael made 'wood' fires in the fireplace, as we played cards or read in the main room. The breakfast was fabulous. Brenda created a feast for us, which included, homemade breads, jams, canned and fresh fruit, homemade dried beef/gravy over biscuits... YUM etc. We stayed in the east wing, family suite and can say that the beds were extremely comfortable and the shower was quite nice even after being the 4th person to use it that morning. Also, we felt comfortable/secure in not feeling the need to lock the doors. Not to many (Hotels/Inns) give you that type of security in them. We had a really enjoyable time and hope to go back again someday.
reviews.title: Comfortable & Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Inn is generally dirty. Outside is somewhat junky. Inn in need of many repairs. Appears to be operating on a 'shoestring' budget. Shower water warm, but not hot. Toilet paper so thin, you could see thru it. Fireplace in room with cardboard logs. Porches are filthy. No ice. No TV. Nothing to do. Owners/host were mostly unfriendly. They took your money upfront and gave very little in return. We go to B&Bs for conversation and to meet new people. They refused idle talk and lived behind closed doors. They seemed bothered by interruptions. They had 4 children and no noise(?). They never thanked us for our business nor asked us back. This is our 30th B&B we have visited and by far the worst. The inn could be a real nice place, but we will never return under the present owners. Internet ad is attractive compared to what you will find. Inn has deteriorated since the pictures were taken.
reviews.title: Take this B&B and 'shove it'

description: Bed & Breakfast overlooking the Little Loyalsock Creek converted from a small circa 1865 hotel
